history.content: Look in the letters of science CS FAQ. 47A doesn't count towards GPA cuttoff, 47b counts as 1 unit towards the GPA requirement, 70 count as 4 unit as usual. These have been pretty consistent guidelines unless you've specific permission from the head major advisor to use a different metric, then it would be case by case.

Hi, I'm a freshman, and to qualify for the major, I need to take CS70 (4 unit), CS47A (1 unit), and CS47B (1 unit).

Could someone please tell me how these classes are truly weighted for the L&S CS GPA cutoff?

Up until this point, I have talked with 3 CS advisors, each of which has given me a different story about which classes are used and how they are weighted with respect to units.

To clarify, the advisors each used some combination of:

Choose one:

- Counting GPA of each class weighted with the number of units per class

- Counting GPA of each class equally weighted as if each were actually 4 units

Choose one:

- Counting only CS70 and 47A

- Counting only CS70 and 47B

- Counting all three

Any info would be super helpful! Thank you so much.
history.subject: How are bridge courses 47A and 47B counted for GPA cutoff?
